Type.Name: PixbufLoader
Type.ThreadSafetyStatement: Gtk# is thread aware, but not thread safe; See the Gtk# Thread Programming for details.

summary.para: PixbufLoader is a 'passive' pixbuf loader. It's not actively read pix buf data, but 'listen' for incoming data instead. It's useful in a case where you want to read the image data in small chunks. Typical use of PixbufLoader is when you want to read a very large image data or reading image from a slow media (such as a slow network connection).
You can see the "Images" section of GtkDemo to learn how to use PixbufLoader.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool Write (byte[] buf, ulong count);

Docs.summary: Parses the next count bytes of image data from buffer buf.
Docs.param: array of bytes buffer to parse.
Docs.returns: returns true if data was parsed and loaded succesfully.

remarks.para: If the return value is false, the PixbufLoader will be closed.

Docs.summary: Closes the loader.
Docs.returns: returns true on successful close and false on error.
Docs.remarks: During the close, PixbufLoader will parse any data that has not been parsed. If the data is incomplete or corrupted, this method will return false.

remarks.para: This is an internal constructor, and should not be used by user code.
